topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 1.1: Deploying the ESX Compute Proxy

body.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade vCenter ESX compute proxy (compute proxy) is a driver that enables the Compute service to communicate with a VMware vCenter server managing one or more ESX hosts. The HP Helion OpenStack Compute Service (Nova) requires this driver to interface with VMware ESX hypervisor APIs.
After installing and configuring the VMware ESX and vCenter Server, use the following instructions to install the compute proxy. The compute proxy is distributed as open virtual appliance (OVA).
The ESX and vCenter server should be installed within the non-KVM region and attached to the CLM network, as shown in the Technical Overview

section.title: Dowloading the ESX Compute Proxy Template
section.p: The required ESX Compute Center Proxy template is available for download from HDN.

ol.li:
In a browser, navigate to Helion Download Network(HDN).
Click Sign In to log in using your account.
After signing in, click the Downloads link in the menu on the left side of the page.
On the Downloads page, locate vCenter Proxy Appliance.and click Download.
Download the GPG keys to verify signature files. This file is named GPG-HPCSS-Public-Keys.tar. Refer to the Prerequisites for information on verifying the download.
Extract the overcloud_vcenter_compute_proxy.ova file to any local directory. Note the location of the extracted file.

section.title: Deploy Compute Proxy template on ESX Host
section.p: The HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade installation process includes an open virtual appliance (OVA) file, called overcloud_vcenter_compute_proxy.ova, that you import into vCenter. You should have downloaded the template during the Prerequisites. The compute proxy template needs to be available in the vCenter before the deploying the HP Helion OpenStack cloud (before you run hprovision script).

To deploy the proxy:
Launch the VMware vCenter client.
Click File > Deploy OVF Template.
In the Deploy OVF Template wizard, specify the location of the overcloud_vcenter_compute_proxy.ova file.
Click Next and complete the wizard.
It is not required by the cloud deployment for the proxy template to be powered on.

section.title: Integration with existing Cloud Framework
section.p: The hprovision script has been extended to execute hlm_provsionproxy script to provision the compute proxy node(s). This script also appends the provisioned proxy nodes to nodes.json.

Since the proxy nodes are available in nodes.json, they are recognized by the hcfgproc and required metadata is generated for these nodes. Further hnetinit sets the appropriate networking and updates hosts file on these nodes to be configured by the hdeploy process.

section.title: Modify esx.json
section.p: When you provision HP Helion OpenStack during the installation, the hprovision script provisions the compute proxy based on the details specified in the esx.json file.
See Sample esx.json file for details on modifying the esx.json file.
The hlm_provisionproxy script uses pyvmomi library for cloning the Compute Proxy Template and doing the initial configuration on ESX Compute proxy.

body.p: Ones the hprovision script completes, compute-proxy nodes will be added to nodes.json along controllers and other cloud nodes:
The esx.json will be populated with CLM network details from environment.json. Compute Proxy nodes will be assigned static ip based on the cidr calculation.

section.title: Configure CLM network on Compute Proxy
section.p: hnetinit script configures compute proxy with the CLM IP generated by config processor (hnetinit).
At this point we see following interfaces on compute proxy nodes:
eth1.x.cfg – This interface holds the temporary CLM IP used for provisioning and configuration
eth0.x.cfg – This sub interface holds the CLM IP allotted by config processor used during cloud deployment

section.title: Configure nova-compute as proxy
section.p: During the hdeploy process CPX-CFG role is responsible for making necessary changes to nova.conf file to make the nova-compute node behave as proxy.
This role also deletes the temporary eth1.x interface on the proxy created during hprovision process.
